verses.verse: My son, <S%H1121><s%> if <S%H518><s%> you have become <S%H6148><s%> surety <S%H6148><s%> for your neighbor, <S%H7453><s%> Have given <S%H8628><s%> a pledge <S%H3709><s%> for a stranger, <S%H2114><s%>
[If] you have been snared <S%H3369><s%> with the words <S%H561><s%> of your mouth, <S%H6310><s%> Have been caught <S%H3920><s%> with the words <S%H561><s%> of your mouth, <S%H6310><s%>

Do <S%H6213><s%> this <S%H384><s%> then, <S%H645><s%> my son, <S%H1121><s%> and deliver <S%H5337><s%> yourself; <S%H5337><s%> Since <S%H3588><s%> you have come <S%H935><s%> into the hand <S%H3709><s%> of your neighbor, <S%H7453><s%> Go, <S%H1980><s%> humble <S%H7511><s%> yourself, and importune <S%H7292><s%> your neighbor. <S%H7453><s%>
Do not give <S%H5414><s%> sleep <S%H8142><s%> to your eyes, <S%H5869><s%> Nor <S%H408><s%> slumber <S%H8572><s%> to your eyelids; <S%H6079><s%>

Deliver <S%H5337><s%> yourself <S%H5337><s%> like a gazelle <S%H6643><s%> from [the hunter's] hand, <S%H3027><s%> And like a bird <S%H6833><s%> from the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the fowler. <S%H3353><s%>
Go <S%H1980><s%> to the ant, <S%H5244><s%> O sluggard, <S%H6102><s%> Observe <S%H7200><s%> her ways and be wise, <S%H2449><s%>
Which, <S%H834><s%> having <S%H369><s%> no <S%H369><s%> chief, <S%H7101><s%> Officer <S%H7860><s%> or ruler, <S%H4910><s%>
Prepares <S%H3559><s%> her food <S%H3899><s%> in the summer, <S%H7019><s%> [And] gathers <S%H103><s%> her provision <S%H3978><s%> in the harvest. <S%H7105><s%>
How <S%H4970><s%> long <S%H5704><s%> will you lie <S%H7901><s%> down, <S%H7901><s%> O sluggard <S%H6102><s%>? When <S%H4970><s%> will you arise <S%H6965><s%> from your sleep <S%H8142><s%>?
"A little <S%H4592><s%> sleep, <S%H8142><s%> a little <S%H4592><s%> slumber, <S%H8572><s%> A little <S%H4592><s%> folding <S%H2264><s%> of the hands <S%H3027><s%> to rest <S%H7901><s%>" â€“
And your poverty <S%H7389><s%> will come <S%H935><s%> in like a vagabond, <S%H1980><s%> And your need <S%H4270><s%> like an armed <S%H4043><s%> man. <S%H376><s%>
A worthless <S%H1100><s%> person, <S%H120><s%> a wicked <S%H205><s%> man, <S%H376><s%> Is the one who walks <S%H1980><s%> with a false <S%H6143><s%> mouth, <S%H6310><s%>
Who winks <S%H7169><s%> with his eyes, <S%H5869><s%> who signals <S%H9267><s%> with his feet, <S%H7272><s%> Who points <S%H3384><s%> with his fingers; <S%H676><s%>
Who [with] perversity <S%H8419><s%> in his heart <S%H3820><s%> devises <S%H9177><s%> evil <S%H9563><s%> continually, <S%H3605><s%> <S%H6256><s%> Who spreads <S%H7971><s%> strife. <S%H4066><s%>

Therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> his calamity <S%H343><s%> will come <S%H935><s%> suddenly; <S%H6597><s%> Instantly <S%H6621><s%> he will be broken, <S%H7665><s%> and there <S%H369><s%> will be no <S%H369><s%> healing. <S%H4832><s%>
There <S%H1992><s%> are six <S%H8337><s%> things <S%H8337><s%> which the Lord <S%H3068><s%> hates, <S%H8130><s%> Yes, seven <S%H7651><s%> which are an abomination <S%H8441><s%> to Him:
Haughty <S%H7311><s%> eyes, <S%H5869><s%> a lying <S%H8267><s%> tongue, <S%H3956><s%> And hands <S%H3027><s%> that shed <S%H8210><s%> innocent <S%H9345><s%> blood, <S%H1818><s%>
A heart <S%H3820><s%> that devises <S%H9177><s%> wicked <S%H205><s%> plans, <S%H4284><s%> Feet <S%H7272><s%> that run <S%H7323><s%> rapidly <S%H4116><s%> to evil, <S%H9567><s%>
A false <S%H8267><s%> witness <S%H5707><s%> [who] utters <S%H6315><s%> lies, <S%H3577><s%> And one who spreads <S%H7971><s%> strife <S%H4090><s%> among <S%H996><s%> brothers. <S%H251><s%>
My son, <S%H1121><s%> observe <S%H5341><s%> the commandment <S%H4687><s%> of your father, And do not forsake <S%H1><s%> the teaching <S%H5203><s%> of your mother; <S%H8451><s%>
Bind <S%H7194><s%> them continually <S%H8548><s%> on your heart; <S%H3820><s%> Tie <S%H6029><s%> them around <S%H5921><s%> your neck. <S%H1621><s%>

When you walk <S%H1980><s%> about, they will guide <S%H5148><s%> you; When you sleep, <S%H7901><s%> they will watch <S%H8104><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> you; And when you awake, <S%H9516><s%> they will talk <S%H7878><s%> to you.

For the commandment <S%H4687><s%> is a lamp, <S%H5216><s%> and the teaching <S%H8451><s%> is light; <S%H216><s%> And reproofs <S%H9640><s%> for discipline <S%H4148><s%> are the way <S%H1870><s%> of life, <S%H9132><s%>
To keep <S%H8104><s%> you from the evil <S%H9563><s%> woman, <S%H802><s%> From the smooth <S%H9142><s%> tongue <S%H3956><s%> of the adulteress. <S%H5237><s%>
Do not desire <S%H2530><s%> her beauty <S%H3308><s%> in your heart, <S%H3824><s%> Nor <S%H408><s%> let her catch <S%H3947><s%> you with her eyelids. <S%H6079><s%>

For on account <S%H1157><s%> of a harlot <S%H2181><s%> [one is reduced] to a loaf <S%H3603><s%> of bread, <S%H3899><s%> And an adulteress <S%H802><s%> <S%H376><s%> hunts <S%H6679><s%> for the precious <S%H3368><s%> life. <S%H5315><s%>
Can a man <S%H376><s%> take <S%H2846><s%> fire <S%H784><s%> in his bosom, <S%H2436><s%> And his clothes <S%H899><s%> not be burned <S%H8313><s%>?
Or <S%H518><s%> can a man <S%H376><s%> walk <S%H1980><s%> on hot coals, <S%H1513><s%> And his feet <S%H7272><s%> not be scorched <S%H3554><s%>?
So <S%H3651><s%> is the one who goes <S%H935><s%> in to his neighbor's wife; <S%H802><s%> Whoever <S%H3605><s%> touches <S%H5060><s%> her will not go <S%H5352><s%> unpunished. <S%H5352><s%>
Men do not despise <S%H936><s%> a thief <S%H1590><s%> if <S%H3588><s%> he steals <S%H1589><s%> To satisfy <S%H4390><s%> himself <S%H5315><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> he is hungry; <S%H7456><s%>
But when he is found, <S%H4672><s%> he must repay <S%H9608><s%> sevenfold; <S%H7659><s%> He must give <S%H5414><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the substance <S%H1952><s%> of his house. <S%H1004><s%>

The one who commits <S%H5003><s%> adultery <S%H5003><s%> with a woman <S%H802><s%> is lacking <S%H2638><s%> sense; <S%H3820><s%> He who would destroy <S%H7843><s%> himself <S%H5315><s%> does <S%H6213><s%> it.
Wounds <S%H5061><s%> and disgrace <S%H7036><s%> he will find, <S%H4672><s%> And his reproach <S%H2781><s%> will not be blotted <S%H4229><s%> out.
For jealousy <S%H7068><s%> enrages <S%H2534><s%> a man, <S%H1397><s%> And he will not spare <S%H2550><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> of vengeance. <S%H5359><s%>

He will not accept <S%H5375><s%> <S%H6440><s%> any <S%H3605><s%> ransom, <S%H3724><s%> Nor <S%H3808><s%> will he be content <S%H14><s%> though <S%H3588><s%> you give <S%H7235><s%> many <S%H7235><s%> gifts. <S%H7810><s%>
